trans-unit.source: Build your Visual Studio solution
trans-unit.target: Build your Visual Studio solution

trans-unit.source: After you have <linkText>deployed a Windows build agent</linkText><title></title>, you are ready to define a CI build that compiles and tests your Visual Studio solutions whenever your team checks in code.
trans-unit.target: After you have <linkText>deployed a Windows build agent</linkText><title></title>, you are ready to define a CI build that compiles and tests your Visual Studio solutions whenever your team checks in code.

trans-unit.source: Create the definition
trans-unit.target: Create the definition

trans-unit.source: Create the build definition.
trans-unit.target: Create the build definition.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Build tab</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Build tab</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Visual Studio build</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Visual Studio build</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the continuous integration (CI) trigger and specify the code you want to build
trans-unit.target: Select the continuous integration (CI) trigger and specify the code you want to build

trans-unit.source: <linkText>CI trigger</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>CI trigger</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Save the definition.
trans-unit.target: Save the definition.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Save button</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Save button</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Save the build</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Save the build</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Queue your new definition to make sure it works.
trans-unit.target: Queue your new definition to make sure it works.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Queue the build</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Queue the build</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Completed build</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Completed build</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Q&A
trans-unit.target: Q&A

trans-unit.source: How do I customize my build?
trans-unit.target: How do I customize my build?

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Run a PowerShell script</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Run a PowerShell script</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: How do I combine check-ins to run fewer builds?
trans-unit.target: How do I combine check-ins to run fewer builds?

trans-unit.source: On the Triggers tab, select Batch changes.
trans-unit.target: On the Triggers tab, select Batch changes.

trans-unit.source: When you select this option, the build system runs only one build per branch at a time.
trans-unit.target: When you select this option, the build system runs only one build per branch at a time.

trans-unit.source: Any pushes or check-ins that occur while a build is running are combined and built together when the current build is completed.
trans-unit.target: Any pushes or check-ins that occur while a build is running are combined and built together when the current build is completed.

trans-unit.source: How do I automatically purge old builds?
trans-unit.target: How do I automatically purge old builds?

trans-unit.source: If you are using Visual Studio Online, you can specify retention rules.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Visual Studio Online, you can specify retention rules.

trans-unit.source: This feature is not yet available for on-premises Team Foundation servers.
trans-unit.target: This feature is not yet available for on-premises Team Foundation servers.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Retention rules</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Retention rules</linkText>

trans-unit.source: How do I build multiple configurations for multiple platforms? Can I build them in parallel?
trans-unit.target: How do I build multiple configurations for multiple platforms? Can I build them in parallel?

trans-unit.source: Select MultiConfiguration to build multiple configurations for multiple platforms.
trans-unit.target: Select MultiConfiguration to build multiple configurations for multiple platforms.

trans-unit.source: Select Parallel if you want to distribute the jobs (one for each combination of values) to multiple agents in parallel if they are available.
trans-unit.target: Select Parallel if you want to distribute the jobs (one for each combination of values) to multiple agents in parallel if they are available.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>MultiConfiguration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>MultiConfiguration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Make sure to declare and assign values to the variables.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to declare and assign values to the variables.

trans-unit.source: To specify multiple values, separate them with commas.
trans-unit.target: To specify multiple values, separate them with commas.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>config and platform build variables</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>config and platform build variables</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Pass the variables to to the Visual Studio build step so that it passes them as arguments to MSBuild.
trans-unit.target: Pass the variables to to the Visual Studio build step so that it passes them as arguments to MSBuild.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Visual Studio build platform and configuration paramaters</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Visual Studio build platform and configuration paramaters</linkText>
